areas_of_interest.name: Sankore Mosque
areas_of_interest.description: A 14th-century center of learning and part of the University of Timbuktu.

areas_of_interest.name: Djinguereber Mosque
areas_of_interest.description: Built in 1327 by Sultan Mansa Musa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

areas_of_interest.name: Sidi Yahya Mosque
areas_of_interest.description: Completed in 1440, part of Timbuktu's UNESCO-listed mosques.

areas_of_interest.name: Ahmed Baba Institute
areas_of_interest.description: Home to thousands of ancient manuscripts from Timbuktu's golden age.

areas_of_interest.name: Timbuktu Manuscripts
areas_of_interest.description: Historic African and Islamic texts preserved in libraries.

areas_of_interest.name: Timbuktu Market
areas_of_interest.description: Vibrant market reflecting Saharan trade traditions.

areas_of_interest.name: Tomb of Askia
areas_of_interest.description: Built in 1495 by Askia Mohammad I, this mud-brick tomb reflects Songhai Empire power and Islamic tradition.

areas_of_interest.name: The Sahara Desert
areas_of_interest.description: Dunes and camel treks near Timbuktu.

metadata.significance: Historic center of trade and Islamic scholarship
